intro: Satyrium situsanguinum, commonly known as the blood-red orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, vivid red petals and sepals. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on forest floors or rocky substrates. Its flowers are small but numerous, arranged in dense clusters that attract specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, Satyrium situsanguinum is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
